intro: Amphithalea ericifolia subsp. erecta, commonly known as the erect form of the heath shrub, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of coastal and mountainous ecosystems.
